00073 static void drawObjectConstraint(TransInfo *t);

00075 /* ************************** CONSTRAINTS ************************* */
00076 static void constraintAutoValues(TransInfo *t, float vec[3])
00077 {
00078     int mode = t->con.mode;
00079     if (mode & CON_APPLY)
00080     {
00081         float nval = (t->flag & T_NULL_ONE)?1.0f:0.0f;
00082 
00083         if ((mode & CON_AXIS0) == 0) {
00084             vec[0] = nval;
00085         }
00086         if ((mode & CON_AXIS1) == 0) {
00087             vec[1] = nval;
00088         }
00089         if ((mode & CON_AXIS2) == 0) {
00090             vec[2] = nval;
00091         }
00092     }
00093 }
00094 
00095 void constraintNumInput(TransInfo *t, float vec[3])
00096 {
00097     int mode = t->con.mode;
00098     if (mode & CON_APPLY) {
00099         float nval = (t->flag & T_NULL_ONE)?1.0f:0.0f;
00100 
00101         if (getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) == 2) {
00102             int axis = mode & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2);
00103             if (axis == (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1)) {
00104                 /* vec[0] = vec[0]; */ /* same */
00105                 /* vec[1] = vec[1]; */ /* same */
00106                 vec[2] = nval;
00107             }
00108             else if (axis == (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2)) {
00109                 vec[2] = vec[1];
00110                 vec[1] = vec[0];
00111                 vec[0] = nval;
00112             }
00113             else if (axis == (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2)) {
00114                 /* vec[0] = vec[0]; */  /* same */
00115                 vec[2] = vec[1];
00116                 vec[1] = nval;
00117             }
00118         }
00119         else if (getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) == 1) {
00120             if (mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00121                 /* vec[0] = vec[0]; */ /* same */
00122                 vec[1] = nval;
00123                 vec[2] = nval;
00124             }
00125             else if (mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00126                 vec[1] = vec[0];
00127                 vec[0] = nval;
00128                 vec[2] = nval;
00129             }
00130             else if (mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00131                 vec[2] = vec[0];
00132                 vec[0] = nval;
00133                 vec[1] = nval;
00134             }
00135         }
00136     }
00137 }
00138 
00139 static void postConstraintChecks(TransInfo *t, float vec[3], float pvec[3])
00140 {
00141     int i = 0;
00142 
00143     mul_m3_v3(t->con.imtx, vec);
00144 
00145     snapGrid(t, vec);
00146 
00147     if (t->num.flag & T_NULL_ONE) {
00148         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0))
00149             vec[0] = 1.0f;
00150 
00151         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1))
00152             vec[1] = 1.0f;
00153 
00154         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2))
00155             vec[2] = 1.0f;
00156     }
00157 
00158     if (hasNumInput(&t->num)) {
00159         applyNumInput(&t->num, vec);
00160         removeAspectRatio(t, vec);
00161         constraintNumInput(t, vec);
00162     }
00163 
00164     /* autovalues is operator param, use that directly but not if snapping is forced */
00165     if (t->flag & T_AUTOVALUES && (t->tsnap.status & SNAP_FORCED) == 0) {
00166         mul_v3_m3v3(vec, t->con.imtx, t->auto_values);
00167         constraintAutoValues(t, vec);
00168         /* inverse transformation at the end */
00169     }
00170 
00171     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00172         pvec[i++] = vec[0];
00173     }
00174     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00175         pvec[i++] = vec[1];
00176     }
00177     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00178         pvec[i++] = vec[2];
00179     }
00180 
00181     mul_m3_v3(t->con.mtx, vec);
00182 }
00183 
00184 static void viewAxisCorrectCenter(TransInfo *t, float t_con_center[3])
00185 {
00186     if (t->spacetype == SPACE_VIEW3D) {
00187         // View3D *v3d = t->sa->spacedata.first;
00188         const float min_dist= 1.0f; // v3d->near;
00189         float dir[3];
00190         float l;
00191 
00192         sub_v3_v3v3(dir, t_con_center, t->viewinv[3]);
00193         if (dot_v3v3(dir, t->viewinv[2]) < 0.0f) {
00194             negate_v3(dir);
00195         }
00196         project_v3_v3v3(dir, dir, t->viewinv[2]);
00197 
00198         l= len_v3(dir);
00199 
00200         if (l < min_dist) {
00201             float diff[3];
00202             normalize_v3_v3(diff, t->viewinv[2]);
00203             mul_v3_fl(diff, min_dist - l);
00204 
00205             sub_v3_v3(t_con_center, diff);
00206         }
00207     }
00208 }
00209 
00210 static void axisProjection(TransInfo *t, float axis[3], float in[3], float out[3])
00211 {
00212     float norm[3], vec[3], factor, angle;
00213     float t_con_center[3];
00214 
00215     if (in[0]==0.0f && in[1]==0.0f && in[2]==0.0f)
00216         return;
00217 
00218     copy_v3_v3(t_con_center, t->con.center);
00219 
00220     /* checks for center being too close to the view center */
00221     viewAxisCorrectCenter(t, t_con_center);
00222     
00223     angle = fabsf(angle_v3v3(axis, t->viewinv[2]));
00224     if (angle > (float)M_PI / 2.0f) {
00225         angle = (float)M_PI - angle;
00226     }
00227     angle = RAD2DEGF(angle);
00228 
00229     /* For when view is parallel to constraint... will cause NaNs otherwise
00230      * So we take vertical motion in 3D space and apply it to the
00231      * constraint axis. Nice for camera grab + MMB */
00232     if (angle < 5.0f) {
00233         project_v3_v3v3(vec, in, t->viewinv[1]);
00234         factor = dot_v3v3(t->viewinv[1], vec) * 2.0f;
00235         /* since camera distance is quite relative, use quadratic relationship. holding shift can compensate */
00236         if (factor<0.0f) factor*= -factor;
00237         else factor*= factor;
00238 
00239         copy_v3_v3(out, axis);
00240         normalize_v3(out);
00241         mul_v3_fl(out, -factor);    /* -factor makes move down going backwards */
00242     }
00243     else {
00244         float v[3], i1[3], i2[3];
00245         float v2[3], v4[3];
00246         float norm_center[3];
00247         float plane[3];
00248 
00249         getViewVector(t, t_con_center, norm_center);
00250         cross_v3_v3v3(plane, norm_center, axis);
00251 
00252         project_v3_v3v3(vec, in, plane);
00253         sub_v3_v3v3(vec, in, vec);
00254         
00255         add_v3_v3v3(v, vec, t_con_center);
00256         getViewVector(t, v, norm);
00257 
00258         /* give arbitrary large value if projection is impossible */
00259         factor = dot_v3v3(axis, norm);
00260         if (1.0f - fabsf(factor) < 0.0002f) {
00261             copy_v3_v3(out, axis);
00262             if (factor > 0) {
00263                 mul_v3_fl(out, 1000000000.0f);
00264             }
00265             else {
00266                 mul_v3_fl(out, -1000000000.0f);
00267             }
00268         }
00269         else {
00270             add_v3_v3v3(v2, t_con_center, axis);
00271             add_v3_v3v3(v4, v, norm);
00272             
00273             isect_line_line_v3(t_con_center, v2, v, v4, i1, i2);
00274             
00275             sub_v3_v3v3(v, i2, v);
00276     
00277             sub_v3_v3v3(out, i1, t_con_center);
00278 
00279             /* possible some values become nan when
00280              * viewpoint and object are both zero */
00281             if (!finite(out[0])) out[0]= 0.0f;
00282             if (!finite(out[1])) out[1]= 0.0f;
00283             if (!finite(out[2])) out[2]= 0.0f;
00284         }
00285     }
00286 }
00287 
00288 static void planeProjection(TransInfo *t, float in[3], float out[3])
00289 {
00290     float vec[3], factor, norm[3];
00291 
00292     add_v3_v3v3(vec, in, t->con.center);
00293     getViewVector(t, vec, norm);
00294 
00295     sub_v3_v3v3(vec, out, in);
00296 
00297     factor = dot_v3v3(vec, norm);
00298     if (fabs(factor) <= 0.001) {
00299         return; /* prevent divide by zero */
00300     }
00301     factor = dot_v3v3(vec, vec) / factor;
00302 
00303     copy_v3_v3(vec, norm);
00304     mul_v3_fl(vec, factor);
00305 
00306     add_v3_v3v3(out, in, vec);
00307 }
00308 
00309 /*
00310  * Generic callback for constant spacial constraints applied to linear motion
00311  *
00312  * The IN vector in projected into the constrained space and then further
00313  * projected along the view vector.
00314  * (in perspective mode, the view vector is relative to the position on screen)
00315  *
00316  */
00317 
00318 static void applyAxisConstraintVec(TransInfo *t, TransData *td, float in[3], float out[3], float pvec[3])
00319 {
00320     copy_v3_v3(out, in);
00321     if (!td && t->con.mode & CON_APPLY) {
00322         mul_m3_v3(t->con.pmtx, out);
00323 
00324         // With snap, a projection is alright, no need to correct for view alignment
00325         if (!(t->tsnap.mode != SCE_SNAP_MODE_INCREMENT && activeSnap(t))) {
00326             if (getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) == 2) {
00327                 if (out[0] != 0.0f || out[1] != 0.0f || out[2] != 0.0f) {
00328                     planeProjection(t, in, out);
00329                 }
00330             }
00331             else if (getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) == 1) {
00332                 float c[3];
00333 
00334                 if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00335                     copy_v3_v3(c, t->con.mtx[0]);
00336                 }
00337                 else if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00338                     copy_v3_v3(c, t->con.mtx[1]);
00339                 }
00340                 else if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00341                     copy_v3_v3(c, t->con.mtx[2]);
00342                 }
00343                 axisProjection(t, c, in, out);
00344             }
00345         }
00346         postConstraintChecks(t, out, pvec);
00347     }
00348 }
00349 
00350 /*
00351  * Generic callback for object based spatial constraints applied to linear motion
00352  *
00353  * At first, the following is applied to the first data in the array
00354  * The IN vector in projected into the constrained space and then further
00355  * projected along the view vector.
00356  * (in perspective mode, the view vector is relative to the position on screen)
00357  *
00358  * Further down, that vector is mapped to each data's space.
00359  */
00360 
00361 static void applyObjectConstraintVec(TransInfo *t, TransData *td, float in[3], float out[3], float pvec[3])
00362 {
00363     copy_v3_v3(out, in);
00364     if (t->con.mode & CON_APPLY) {
00365         if (!td) {
00366             mul_m3_v3(t->con.pmtx, out);
00367             if (getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) == 2) {
00368                 if (out[0] != 0.0f || out[1] != 0.0f || out[2] != 0.0f) {
00369                     planeProjection(t, in, out);
00370                 }
00371             }
00372             else if (getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) == 1) {
00373                 float c[3];
00374 
00375                 if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00376                     copy_v3_v3(c, t->con.mtx[0]);
00377                 }
00378                 else if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00379                     copy_v3_v3(c, t->con.mtx[1]);
00380                 }
00381                 else if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00382                     copy_v3_v3(c, t->con.mtx[2]);
00383                 }
00384                 axisProjection(t, c, in, out);
00385             }
00386             postConstraintChecks(t, out, pvec);
00387             copy_v3_v3(out, pvec);
00388         }
00389         else {
00390             int i=0;
00391 
00392             out[0] = out[1] = out[2] = 0.0f;
00393             if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00394                 out[0] = in[i++];
00395             }
00396             if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00397                 out[1] = in[i++];
00398             }
00399             if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00400                 out[2] = in[i++];
00401             }
00402             mul_m3_v3(td->axismtx, out);
00403         }
00404     }
00405 }

00407 /*
00408  * Generic callback for constant spacial constraints applied to resize motion
00409  *
00410  *
00411  */
00412 
00413 static void applyAxisConstraintSize(TransInfo *t, TransData *td, float smat[3][3])
00414 {
00415     if (!td && t->con.mode & CON_APPLY) {
00416         float tmat[3][3];
00417 
00418         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0)) {
00419             smat[0][0] = 1.0f;
00420         }
00421         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1)) {
00422             smat[1][1] = 1.0f;
00423         }
00424         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2)) {
00425             smat[2][2] = 1.0f;
00426         }
00427 
00428         mul_m3_m3m3(tmat, smat, t->con.imtx);
00429         mul_m3_m3m3(smat, t->con.mtx, tmat);
00430     }
00431 }
00432 
00433 /*
00434  * Callback for object based spacial constraints applied to resize motion
00435  *
00436  *
00437  */
00438 
00439 static void applyObjectConstraintSize(TransInfo *t, TransData *td, float smat[3][3])
00440 {
00441     if (td && t->con.mode & CON_APPLY) {
00442         float tmat[3][3];
00443         float imat[3][3];
00444 
00445         invert_m3_m3(imat, td->axismtx);
00446 
00447         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0)) {
00448             smat[0][0] = 1.0f;
00449         }
00450         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1)) {
00451             smat[1][1] = 1.0f;
00452         }
00453         if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2)) {
00454             smat[2][2] = 1.0f;
00455         }
00456 
00457         mul_m3_m3m3(tmat, smat, imat);
00458         mul_m3_m3m3(smat, td->axismtx, tmat);
00459     }
00460 }
00461 
00462 /*
00463  * Generic callback for constant spacial constraints applied to rotations
00464  *
00465  * The rotation axis is copied into VEC.
00466  *
00467  * In the case of single axis constraints, the rotation axis is directly the one constrained to.
00468  * For planar constraints (2 axis), the rotation axis is the normal of the plane.
00469  *
00470  * The following only applies when CON_NOFLIP is not set.
00471  * The vector is then modified to always point away from the screen (in global space)
00472  * This insures that the rotation is always logically following the mouse.
00473  * (ie: not doing counterclockwise rotations when the mouse moves clockwise).
00474  */
00475 
00476 static void applyAxisConstraintRot(TransInfo *t, TransData *td, float vec[3], float *angle)
00477 {
00478     if (!td && t->con.mode & CON_APPLY) {
00479         int mode = t->con.mode & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2);
00480 
00481         switch(mode) {
00482         case CON_AXIS0:
00483         case (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2):
00484             copy_v3_v3(vec, t->con.mtx[0]);
00485             break;
00486         case CON_AXIS1:
00487         case (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2):
00488             copy_v3_v3(vec, t->con.mtx[1]);
00489             break;
00490         case CON_AXIS2:
00491         case (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1):
00492             copy_v3_v3(vec, t->con.mtx[2]);
00493             break;
00494         }
00495         /* don't flip axis if asked to or if num input */
00496         if (angle && (mode & CON_NOFLIP) == 0 && hasNumInput(&t->num) == 0) {
00497             if (dot_v3v3(vec, t->viewinv[2]) > 0.0f) {
00498                 *angle = -(*angle);
00499             }
00500         }
00501     }
00502 }
00503 
00504 /*
00505  * Callback for object based spacial constraints applied to rotations
00506  *
00507  * The rotation axis is copied into VEC.
00508  *
00509  * In the case of single axis constraints, the rotation axis is directly the one constrained to.
00510  * For planar constraints (2 axis), the rotation axis is the normal of the plane.
00511  *
00512  * The following only applies when CON_NOFLIP is not set.
00513  * The vector is then modified to always point away from the screen (in global space)
00514  * This insures that the rotation is always logically following the mouse.
00515  * (ie: not doing counterclockwise rotations when the mouse moves clockwise).
00516  */
00517 
00518 static void applyObjectConstraintRot(TransInfo *t, TransData *td, float vec[3], float *angle)
00519 {
00520     if (t->con.mode & CON_APPLY) {
00521         int mode = t->con.mode & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2);
00522 
00523         /* on setup call, use first object */
00524         if (td == NULL) {
00525             td= t->data;
00526         }
00527 
00528         switch(mode) {
00529         case CON_AXIS0:
00530         case (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2):
00531             copy_v3_v3(vec, td->axismtx[0]);
00532             break;
00533         case CON_AXIS1:
00534         case (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2):
00535             copy_v3_v3(vec, td->axismtx[1]);
00536             break;
00537         case CON_AXIS2:
00538         case (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1):
00539             copy_v3_v3(vec, td->axismtx[2]);
00540             break;
00541         }
00542         if (angle && (mode & CON_NOFLIP) == 0 && hasNumInput(&t->num) == 0) {
00543             if (dot_v3v3(vec, t->viewinv[2]) > 0.0f) {
00544                 *angle = -(*angle);
00545             }
00546         }
00547     }
00548 }
00549 
00550 /*--------------------- INTERNAL SETUP CALLS ------------------*/
00551 
00552 void setConstraint(TransInfo *t, float space[3][3], int mode, const char text[])
00553 {
00554     BLI_strncpy(t->con.text + 1, text, sizeof(t->con.text) - 1);
00555     copy_m3_m3(t->con.mtx, space);
00556     t->con.mode = mode;
00557     getConstraintMatrix(t);
00558 
00559     startConstraint(t);
00560 
00561     t->con.drawExtra = NULL;
00562     t->con.applyVec = applyAxisConstraintVec;
00563     t->con.applySize = applyAxisConstraintSize;
00564     t->con.applyRot = applyAxisConstraintRot;
00565     t->redraw = 1;
00566 }
00567 
00568 void setLocalConstraint(TransInfo *t, int mode, const char text[])
00569 {
00570     if (t->flag & T_EDIT) {
00571         float obmat[3][3];
00572         copy_m3_m4(obmat, t->scene->obedit->obmat);
00573         normalize_m3(obmat);
00574         setConstraint(t, obmat, mode, text);
00575     }
00576     else {
00577         if (t->total == 1) {
00578             setConstraint(t, t->data->axismtx, mode, text);
00579         }
00580         else {
00581             BLI_strncpy(t->con.text + 1, text, sizeof(t->con.text) - 1);
00582             copy_m3_m3(t->con.mtx, t->data->axismtx);
00583             t->con.mode = mode;
00584             getConstraintMatrix(t);
00585 
00586             startConstraint(t);
00587 
00588             t->con.drawExtra = drawObjectConstraint;
00589             t->con.applyVec = applyObjectConstraintVec;
00590             t->con.applySize = applyObjectConstraintSize;
00591             t->con.applyRot = applyObjectConstraintRot;
00592             t->redraw = 1;
00593         }
00594     }
00595 }
00596 
00597 /*
00598  * Set the constraint according to the user defined orientation
00599  *
00600  * ftext is a format string passed to BLI_snprintf. It will add the name of
00601  * the orientation where %s is (logically).
00602  */
00603 void setUserConstraint(TransInfo *t, short orientation, int mode, const char ftext[])
00604 {
00605     char text[40];
00606 
00607     switch(orientation) {
00608     case V3D_MANIP_GLOBAL:
00609         {
00610             float mtx[3][3]= MAT3_UNITY;
00611             BLI_snprintf(text, sizeof(text), ftext, "global");
00612             setConstraint(t, mtx, mode, text);
00613         }
00614         break;
00615     case V3D_MANIP_LOCAL:
00616         BLI_snprintf(text, sizeof(text), ftext, "local");
00617         setLocalConstraint(t, mode, text);
00618         break;
00619     case V3D_MANIP_NORMAL:
00620         BLI_snprintf(text, sizeof(text), ftext, "normal");
00621         setConstraint(t, t->spacemtx, mode, text);
00622         break;
00623     case V3D_MANIP_VIEW:
00624         BLI_snprintf(text, sizeof(text), ftext, "view");
00625         setConstraint(t, t->spacemtx, mode, text);
00626         break;
00627     case V3D_MANIP_GIMBAL:
00628         BLI_snprintf(text, sizeof(text), ftext, "gimbal");
00629         setConstraint(t, t->spacemtx, mode, text);
00630         break;
00631     default: /* V3D_MANIP_CUSTOM */
00632         BLI_snprintf(text, sizeof(text), ftext, t->spacename);
00633         setConstraint(t, t->spacemtx, mode, text);
00634         break;
00635     }
00636 
00637     t->con.orientation = orientation;
00638 
00639     t->con.mode |= CON_USER;
00640 }
00641 
00642 /*----------------- DRAWING CONSTRAINTS -------------------*/
00643 
00644 void drawConstraint(TransInfo *t)
00645 {
00646     TransCon *tc = &(t->con);
00647 
00648     if (!ELEM(t->spacetype, SPACE_VIEW3D, SPACE_IMAGE))
00649         return;
00650     if (!(tc->mode & CON_APPLY))
00651         return;
00652     if (t->flag & T_USES_MANIPULATOR)
00653         return;
00654     if (t->flag & T_NO_CONSTRAINT)
00655         return;
00656 
00657     /* nasty exception for Z constraint in camera view */
00658     // TRANSFORM_FIX_ME
00659 //  if ((t->flag & T_OBJECT) && G.vd->camera==OBACT && G.vd->persp==V3D_CAMOB)
00660 //      return;
00661 
00662     if (tc->drawExtra) {
00663         tc->drawExtra(t);
00664     }
00665     else {
00666         if (tc->mode & CON_SELECT) {
00667             float vec[3];
00668             char col2[3] = {255,255,255};
00669             int depth_test_enabled;
00670 
00671             convertViewVec(t, vec, (t->mval[0] - t->con.imval[0]), (t->mval[1] - t->con.imval[1]));
00672             add_v3_v3(vec, tc->center);
00673 
00674             drawLine(t, tc->center, tc->mtx[0], 'X', 0);
00675             drawLine(t, tc->center, tc->mtx[1], 'Y', 0);
00676             drawLine(t, tc->center, tc->mtx[2], 'Z', 0);
00677 
00678             glColor3ubv((GLubyte *)col2);
00679 
00680             depth_test_enabled = glIsEnabled(GL_DEPTH_TEST);
00681             if (depth_test_enabled)
00682                 glDisable(GL_DEPTH_TEST);
00683 
00684             setlinestyle(1);
00685             glBegin(GL_LINE_STRIP);
00686                 glVertex3fv(tc->center);
00687                 glVertex3fv(vec);
00688             glEnd();
00689             setlinestyle(0);
00690 
00691             if (depth_test_enabled)
00692                 glEnable(GL_DEPTH_TEST);
00693         }
00694 
00695         if (tc->mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00696             drawLine(t, tc->center, tc->mtx[0], 'X', DRAWLIGHT);
00697         }
00698         if (tc->mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00699             drawLine(t, tc->center, tc->mtx[1], 'Y', DRAWLIGHT);
00700         }
00701         if (tc->mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00702             drawLine(t, tc->center, tc->mtx[2], 'Z', DRAWLIGHT);
00703         }
00704     }
00705 }
00706 
00707 /* called from drawview.c, as an extra per-window draw option */
00708 void drawPropCircle(const struct bContext *C, TransInfo *t)
00709 {
00710     if (t->flag & T_PROP_EDIT) {
00711         RegionView3D *rv3d = CTX_wm_region_view3d(C);
00712         float tmat[4][4], imat[4][4];
00713         float center[3];
00714 
00715         UI_ThemeColor(TH_GRID);
00716 
00717         if (t->spacetype == SPACE_VIEW3D && rv3d != NULL) {
00718             copy_m4_m4(tmat, rv3d->viewmat);
00719             invert_m4_m4(imat, tmat);
00720         }
00721         else {
00722             unit_m4(tmat);
00723             unit_m4(imat);
00724         }
00725 
00726         glPushMatrix();
00727 
00728         copy_v3_v3(center, t->center);
00729 
00730         if ((t->spacetype == SPACE_VIEW3D) && t->obedit) {
00731             mul_m4_v3(t->obedit->obmat, center); /* because t->center is in local space */
00732         }
00733         else if (t->spacetype == SPACE_IMAGE) {
00734             float aspx, aspy;
00735 
00736             ED_space_image_uv_aspect(t->sa->spacedata.first, &aspx, &aspy);
00737             glScalef(1.0f/aspx, 1.0f/aspy, 1.0);
00738         }
00739 
00740         set_inverted_drawing(1);
00741         drawcircball(GL_LINE_LOOP, center, t->prop_size, imat);
00742         set_inverted_drawing(0);
00743 
00744         glPopMatrix();
00745     }
00746 }
00747 
00748 static void drawObjectConstraint(TransInfo *t)
00749 {
00750     int i;
00751     TransData * td = t->data;
00752 
00753     /* Draw the first one lighter because that's the one who controls the others.
00754      * Meaning the transformation is projected on that one and just copied on the others
00755      * constraint space.
00756      * In a nutshell, the object with light axis is controlled by the user and the others follow.
00757      * Without drawing the first light, users have little clue what they are doing.
00758      */
00759     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00760         drawLine(t, td->ob->obmat[3], td->axismtx[0], 'X', DRAWLIGHT);
00761     }
00762     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00763         drawLine(t, td->ob->obmat[3], td->axismtx[1], 'Y', DRAWLIGHT);
00764     }
00765     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00766         drawLine(t, td->ob->obmat[3], td->axismtx[2], 'Z', DRAWLIGHT);
00767     }
00768 
00769     td++;
00770 
00771     for (i=1;i<t->total;i++,td++) {
00772         if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0) {
00773             drawLine(t, td->ob->obmat[3], td->axismtx[0], 'X', 0);
00774         }
00775         if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1) {
00776             drawLine(t, td->ob->obmat[3], td->axismtx[1], 'Y', 0);
00777         }
00778         if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2) {
00779             drawLine(t, td->ob->obmat[3], td->axismtx[2], 'Z', 0);
00780         }
00781     }
00782 }
00783 
00784 /*--------------------- START / STOP CONSTRAINTS ---------------------- */
00785 
00786 void startConstraint(TransInfo *t)
00787 {
00788     t->con.mode |= CON_APPLY;
00789     *t->con.text = ' ';
00790     t->num.idx_max = MIN2(getConstraintSpaceDimension(t) - 1, t->idx_max);
00791 }
00792 
00793 void stopConstraint(TransInfo *t)
00794 {
00795     t->con.mode &= ~(CON_APPLY|CON_SELECT);
00796     *t->con.text = '\0';
00797     t->num.idx_max = t->idx_max;
00798 }
00799 
00800 void getConstraintMatrix(TransInfo *t)
00801 {
00802     float mat[3][3];
00803     invert_m3_m3(t->con.imtx, t->con.mtx);
00804     unit_m3(t->con.pmtx);
00805 
00806     if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0)) {
00807         t->con.pmtx[0][0]       =
00808             t->con.pmtx[0][1]   =
00809             t->con.pmtx[0][2]   = 0.0f;
00810     }
00811 
00812     if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1)) {
00813         t->con.pmtx[1][0]       =
00814             t->con.pmtx[1][1]   =
00815             t->con.pmtx[1][2]   = 0.0f;
00816     }
00817 
00818     if (!(t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2)) {
00819         t->con.pmtx[2][0]       =
00820             t->con.pmtx[2][1]   =
00821             t->con.pmtx[2][2]   = 0.0f;
00822     }
00823 
00824     mul_m3_m3m3(mat, t->con.pmtx, t->con.imtx);
00825     mul_m3_m3m3(t->con.pmtx, t->con.mtx, mat);
00826 }
00827 
00828 /*------------------------- MMB Select -------------------------------*/
00829 
00830 void initSelectConstraint(TransInfo *t, float mtx[3][3])
00831 {
00832     copy_m3_m3(t->con.mtx, mtx);
00833     t->con.mode |= CON_APPLY;
00834     t->con.mode |= CON_SELECT;
00835 
00836     setNearestAxis(t);
00837     t->con.drawExtra = NULL;
00838     t->con.applyVec = applyAxisConstraintVec;
00839     t->con.applySize = applyAxisConstraintSize;
00840     t->con.applyRot = applyAxisConstraintRot;
00841 }
00842 
00843 void selectConstraint(TransInfo *t)
00844 {
00845     if (t->con.mode & CON_SELECT) {
00846         setNearestAxis(t);
00847         startConstraint(t);
00848     }
00849 }
00850 
00851 void postSelectConstraint(TransInfo *t)
00852 {
00853     if (!(t->con.mode & CON_SELECT))
00854         return;
00855 
00856     t->con.mode &= ~CON_AXIS0;
00857     t->con.mode &= ~CON_AXIS1;
00858     t->con.mode &= ~CON_AXIS2;
00859     t->con.mode &= ~CON_SELECT;
00860 
00861     setNearestAxis(t);
00862 
00863     startConstraint(t);
00864     t->redraw = 1;
00865 }
00866 
00867 static void setNearestAxis2d(TransInfo *t)
00868 {
00869     /* no correction needed... just use whichever one is lower */
00870     if ( abs(t->mval[0]-t->con.imval[0]) < abs(t->mval[1]-t->con.imval[1]) ) {
00871         t->con.mode |= CON_AXIS1;
00872         BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " along Y axis");
00873     }
00874     else {
00875         t->con.mode |= CON_AXIS0;
00876         BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " along X axis");
00877     }
00878 }
00879 
00880 static void setNearestAxis3d(TransInfo *t)
00881 {
00882     float zfac;
00883     float mvec[3], axis[3], proj[3];
00884     float len[3];
00885     int i, icoord[2];
00886 
00887     /* calculate mouse movement */
00888     mvec[0] = (float)(t->mval[0] - t->con.imval[0]);
00889     mvec[1] = (float)(t->mval[1] - t->con.imval[1]);
00890     mvec[2] = 0.0f;
00891 
00892     /* we need to correct axis length for the current zoomlevel of view,
00893      * this to prevent projected values to be clipped behind the camera
00894      * and to overflow the short integers.
00895      * The formula used is a bit stupid, just a simplification of the subtraction
00896      * of two 2D points 30 pixels apart (that's the last factor in the formula) after
00897      * projecting them with window_to_3d_delta and then get the length of that vector.
00898      */
00899     zfac= t->persmat[0][3]*t->center[0]+ t->persmat[1][3]*t->center[1]+ t->persmat[2][3]*t->center[2]+ t->persmat[3][3];
00900     zfac = len_v3(t->persinv[0]) * 2.0f/t->ar->winx * zfac * 30.0f;
00901 
00902     for (i = 0; i<3; i++) {
00903         copy_v3_v3(axis, t->con.mtx[i]);
00904 
00905         mul_v3_fl(axis, zfac);
00906         /* now we can project to get window coordinate */
00907         add_v3_v3(axis, t->con.center);
00908         projectIntView(t, axis, icoord);
00909 
00910         axis[0] = (float)(icoord[0] - t->center2d[0]);
00911         axis[1] = (float)(icoord[1] - t->center2d[1]);
00912         axis[2] = 0.0f;
00913 
00914         if (normalize_v3(axis) != 0.0f) {
00915             project_v3_v3v3(proj, mvec, axis);
00916             sub_v3_v3v3(axis, mvec, proj);
00917             len[i] = normalize_v3(axis);
00918         }
00919         else {
00920             len[i] = 10000000000.0f;
00921         }
00922     }
00923 
00924     if (len[0] <= len[1] && len[0] <= len[2]) {
00925         if (t->modifiers & MOD_CONSTRAINT_PLANE) {
00926             t->con.mode |= (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2);
00927             BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " locking %s X axis", t->spacename);
00928         }
00929         else {
00930             t->con.mode |= CON_AXIS0;
00931             BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " along %s X axis", t->spacename);
00932         }
00933     }
00934     else if (len[1] <= len[0] && len[1] <= len[2]) {
00935         if (t->modifiers & MOD_CONSTRAINT_PLANE) {
00936             t->con.mode |= (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2);
00937             BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " locking %s Y axis", t->spacename);
00938         }
00939         else {
00940             t->con.mode |= CON_AXIS1;
00941             BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " along %s Y axis", t->spacename);
00942         }
00943     }
00944     else if (len[2] <= len[1] && len[2] <= len[0]) {
00945         if (t->modifiers & MOD_CONSTRAINT_PLANE) {
00946             t->con.mode |= (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1);
00947             BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " locking %s Z axis", t->spacename);
00948         }
00949         else {
00950             t->con.mode |= CON_AXIS2;
00951             BLI_snprintf(t->con.text, sizeof(t->con.text), " along %s Z axis", t->spacename);
00952         }
00953     }
00954 }
00955 
00956 void setNearestAxis(TransInfo *t)
00957 {
00958     /* clear any prior constraint flags */
00959     t->con.mode &= ~CON_AXIS0;
00960     t->con.mode &= ~CON_AXIS1;
00961     t->con.mode &= ~CON_AXIS2;
00962 
00963     /* constraint setting - depends on spacetype */
00964     if (t->spacetype == SPACE_VIEW3D) {
00965         /* 3d-view */
00966         setNearestAxis3d(t);
00967     }
00968     else {
00969         /* assume that this means a 2D-Editor */
00970         setNearestAxis2d(t);
00971     }
00972 
00973     getConstraintMatrix(t);
00974 }
00975 
00976 /*-------------- HELPER FUNCTIONS ----------------*/
00977 
00978 char constraintModeToChar(TransInfo *t)
00979 {
00980     if ((t->con.mode & CON_APPLY)==0) {
00981         return '\0';
00982     }
00983     switch (t->con.mode & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2)) {
00984     case (CON_AXIS0):
00985     case (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2):
00986         return 'X';
00987     case (CON_AXIS1):
00988     case (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2):
00989         return 'Y';
00990     case (CON_AXIS2):
00991     case (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1):
00992         return 'Z';
00993     default:
00994         return '\0';
00995     }
00996 }
00997 
00998 
00999 int isLockConstraint(TransInfo *t)
01000 {
01001     int mode = t->con.mode;
01002 
01003     if ( (mode & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1)) == (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1))
01004         return 1;
01005 
01006     if ( (mode & (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2)) == (CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2))
01007         return 1;
01008 
01009     if ( (mode & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2)) == (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS2))
01010         return 1;
01011 
01012     return 0;
01013 }
01014 
01015 /*
01016  * Returns the dimension of the constraint space.
01017  *
01018  * For that reason, the flags always needs to be set to properly evaluate here,
01019  * even if they aren't actually used in the callback function. (Which could happen
01020  * for weird constraints not yet designed. Along a path for example.)
01021  */
01022 
01023 int getConstraintSpaceDimension(TransInfo *t)
01024 {
01025     int n = 0;
01026 
01027     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS0)
01028         n++;
01029 
01030     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS1)
01031         n++;
01032 
01033     if (t->con.mode & CON_AXIS2)
01034         n++;
01035 
01036     return n;
01037 /*
01038  * Someone willing to do it cryptically could do the following instead:
01039  *
01040  * return t->con & (CON_AXIS0|CON_AXIS1|CON_AXIS2);
01041  *
01042  * Based on the assumptions that the axis flags are one after the other and start at 1
01043  */
01044 }
